Contributor: Wilson, W. N., artist.; Victory Liberty Loan Committee.;
Note: Signed "W.N. Wilson." Date based on date of Victory Liberty Loan Campaign. Orientation: Vertical.
Description: Text tells about a lost battalion of four hundred and seventy Americans who had no food or shelter, swept by machine gun and shell fire with little hope of escaping. After five days they were offered safety if they surrendered to the enemy. The commander, Major Charles W. Whittlesey replied "Tell them to go to hell!" And then they were saved. Citizens should support their bravery and buy Victory bonds. This is a design for a newspaper advertisement.
Digital Collection: Allied Posters of World War I

Title: "Tell them to go to hell!"
